Key Match Events: Russell Westbrook provided assists on two of his five 3-pointers against Atlanta.
Westbrook was also on the finishing end on three of Nikola Jokic's 15 assists.
Nikola Jokic was on the scoring end of three of Westbrook's 11 assists against Atlanta.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Malone's team has scored at least 132 points in all four games with Russell Westbrook in the starting lineup.
Aaron Gordon is nearing a return from a calf strain, and Malone will have a decision to make about his starting five.
Christian Braun is the leading candidate to replace Russell Westbrook in the starting lineup when Denver's regular starting five is healthy.
Post-Match Reflections: Westbrook quickly established the tone in his first season with the Nuggets as a vocal leader.
Malone wants the team to hold each other accountable and police each other, which he believes will make them special.
The results of Westbrook's impact on the team are hard to argue with.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets improved to 9-2 when Russell Westbrook is in the starting lineup.
Westbrook is averaging 12.8 points and nine assists in the four games since he rejoined the starting lineup.
The Nuggets have scored 19.5 fast-break points per game with Westbrook as a part of their starting lineup.
Others: Michael Malone expects Aaron Gordon back for the next 'couple of games' but stressed the risk of bringing a player with a soft-tissue injury back too soon.
